subject: RE: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: ... It s hard to disagree with that. As far as I know, noone proposed to do anything haphazardly . Again, what I would propose is to meditate deeply about the
messageBody:
> I also agree that it would be wrong to haphazardly
> create a new class and move a method there /just/ so that the
> method could be public for testing.

It's hard to disagree with that. As far as I know, noone proposed to do
anything "haphazardly".

Again, what I would propose is to meditate deeply about the design, in the
hope to find a better one where the method is public.

A private method that is complex enough to need explicite testing *is* a
hint that the design can be improved.

Cheers, Ilja
